casebody.data:
T AND A AMUSEMENTS, LLC; and Crazie Overstock Promotions, LLC
v.
Patrick MCCRORY, in his official capacity as Governor of the State of North Carolina; Frank L. Perry, in his official capacity as Secretary of the North Carolina Department of Public Safety; Mark J. Senter, in his official capacity as Branch Head of the Alcohol Law Enforcement Division, Jody Williams, in his official capacity as the Chief of Police of the City of Asheboro, North Carolina; and Maynard B. Reid, Jr., in his official capacity as the Sheriff of Randolph County No. 89P17 Supreme Court of North Carolina. June 8, 2017 William J. Brian, Jr., Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Keith P. Anthony, Attorney at Law, Durham, for T and A Amusements, LLC, et al. Shannon R. Joseph, Attorney at Law, Raleigh. Hal F. Askins, Special Deputy Attorney General, J. Joy Strickland, Assistant Attorney General, for McCrory, Patrick (Governor), et al. Patrick H. Flanagan, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Jaye E. Bingham-Hinch, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Williams, Jody (Chief of Police). Ben C. Morgan, Attorney at Law, Asheboro, for Reid, Maynard B. (Jr.) (Sheriff). Christopher C. Finan, Attorney at Law, High Point. James C. Lanik, Attorney at Law, High Point.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 14th of March 2017 by Defendants (McCrory, Perry, Senter, and Williams) in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 8th of June 2017."
